title: Baharat-Roasted Aubergine & Chickpea Bowl with Lemon-Tahini — Foodie Fuel
name: Baharat-Roasted Aubergine & Chickpea Bowl with Lemon-Tahini — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Line a tray.
Toss aubergine, onion and chickpeas with oil, baharat and a pinch of salt. Roast 30–35 minutes, turning once, until caramelised.
Whisk tahini, lemon juice, zest, garlic and water into a pourable sauce; season.
Warm the cooked brown rice in the microwave for 1–2 minutes (or in a pan with a splash of water).
plating: Spoon warm rice into bowls.
Pile on the roasted aubergine and chickpeas, then add cabbage for crunch.
Drizzle lemon-tahini over the top and finish with parsley and pickled chillies.
swaps: Swap brown rice for bulgur (contains gluten) or quinoa.
Add toasted sesame seeds for extra texture.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Harissa Chicken Traybake with Lemon-Garlic Yogurt & Charred Peppers — Foodie Fuel
name: Harissa Chicken Traybake with Lemon-Garlic Yogurt & Charred Peppers — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C).
Toss chicken with harissa, oil and a pinch of salt. Arrange on a tray with peppers and onion.
Roast 30–35 minutes until chicken is cooked through (75°C internal).
Stir beans into the tray for the last 8 minutes to warm and catch the roasting juices.
Mix yoghurt with lemon and garlic. Spoon over to serve and finish with mint.
plating: Serve straight from the tray onto warm plates.
Spoon lemon yoghurt in a line and drag a spoon through for a clean swipe.
Top with chicken, peppers and beans; finish with mint.
swaps: Use skyr instead of yoghurt for more protein.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Gochujang Salmon Rice Bowl with Kimchi Cucumber — Foodie Fuel
name: Gochujang Salmon Rice Bowl with Kimchi Cucumber — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C).
Mix gochujang, soy sauce and honey. Brush over salmon.
Roast salmon 10–12 minutes until just cooked.
Toss cucumber with rice vinegar and sesame oil.
Serve salmon over warm brown rice with cucumber and kimchi; sprinkle sesame seeds.
plating: Bowl base: rice.
Place salmon slightly off-centre, then mound cucumber and kimchi beside.
Finish with sesame seeds and a final drizzle of sauce.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Chana Saag with Toasted Cumin Rice — Foodie Fuel
name: Chana Saag with Toasted Cumin Rice — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 8 minutes until soft.
Stir in garlic, ginger and spices; cook 1 minute.
Add passata and chickpeas; simmer 12 minutes.
Stir in spinach and cook 5 minutes until hot. Finish with lemon juice and salt.
Toast cumin seeds in a dry pan 30 seconds, then fold through cooked rice.
plating: Spoon cumin rice into a neat mound.
Ladle chana saag beside and swirl with the back of a spoon.
Finish with a squeeze of lemon.
swaps: Add a spoon of yoghurt if not dairy-free.
Swap chickpeas for red kidney beans.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Smoky Chipotle Black Bean Chilli with Lime-Coriander Slaw — Foodie Fuel
name: Smoky Chipotle Black Bean Chilli with Lime-Coriander Slaw — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 8 minutes until soft.
Add garlic, chipotle and cumin; cook 1 minute.
Add tomatoes, beans, pepper, sweet potato and water; simmer 25–30 minutes until potato is tender.
Mix cabbage with lime juice, a pinch of salt and coriander.
plating: Spoon chilli into bowls.
Top with a tuft of lime-coriander slaw and extra coriander leaves.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Za’atar Roasted Chicken & Bulgur Tabbouleh — Foodie Fuel
name: Za’atar Roasted Chicken & Bulgur Tabbouleh — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Toss chicken with za’atar, oil and a pinch of salt. Roast 22–25 minutes until cooked (75°C internal).
Cover bulgur with boiling water, lid on 12 minutes; fluff and cool slightly.
Stir lemon juice, cucumber, tomatoes and parsley through bulgur. Season.
Slice chicken and serve over tabbouleh.
plating: Tabbouleh as the base, chicken fanned on top.
Finish with extra parsley and a lemon wedge.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Peri-Peri Sardine & Butter Bean Salad with Charred Corn — Foodie Fuel
name: Peri-Peri Sardine & Butter Bean Salad with Charred Corn — Foodie Fuel

ingredients.item: Corn on the cob (or 200 g frozen sweetcorn)

method: Char corn in a hot dry pan 6–8 minutes, turning, then slice off kernels.
Toss butter beans with peri-peri, olive oil and lemon juice.
Fold through rocket, red onion and corn. Top with sardines and their sauce.
plating: Pile salad high, set sardines on top.
Drizzle remaining tomato sauce around the plate.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Thai Red Curry Lentil Soup with Lime & Basil — Foodie Fuel
name: Thai Red Curry Lentil Soup with Lime & Basil — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 6 minutes.
Stir in curry paste 30 seconds.
Add coconut milk, stock and lentils; simmer 18 minutes.
Add carrot and pak choi; simmer 3 minutes.
Finish with lime juice and basil.
plating: Ladle into bowls, basil on top.
Finish with a lime wedge and a few extra chilli flakes if you like.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Spiced Beef Keema & Peas with Brown Rice — Foodie Fuel
name: Spiced Beef Keema & Peas with Brown Rice — Foodie Fuel
method: Dry-fry mince in a hot pan 6–8 minutes until browned; drain excess fat if needed.
Add onion, cook 6 minutes. Add garlic, ginger and spices 1 minute.
Add tomatoes, simmer 12 minutes.
Stir in peas 3 minutes. Season and finish with coriander.
Serve over warmed brown rice.
plating: Rice mound, keema spooned alongside.
Finish with coriander and a lemon wedge.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Cajun Prawn & Okra Tomato Stew with Brown Rice — Foodie Fuel
name: Cajun Prawn & Okra Tomato Stew with Brown Rice — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 6 minutes, add garlic and Cajun seasoning 30 seconds.
Add tomatoes and okra; simmer 12 minutes.
Add prawns; simmer 3–4 minutes until pink and cooked through.
Finish with lemon juice and serve with warm brown rice.
plating: Rice in the base, stew spooned over.
Finish with a squeeze of lemon and cracked black pepper.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Miso-Mushroom Soba Salad with Edamame & Sesame — Foodie Fuel
name: Miso-Mushroom Soba Salad with Edamame & Sesame — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook soba noodles 4–5 minutes, drain and rinse cold.
Boil edamame 3 minutes, drain.
Sauté mushrooms in a dry pan 6–8 minutes until browned.
Whisk miso, soy, vinegar and sesame oil with 1 tbsp water.
Toss noodles with mushrooms, edamame and dressing. Finish with sesame and spring onion.
plating: Twirl noodles into a neat mound, scatter edamame and mushrooms.
Finish with sesame seeds and spring onion.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Mediterranean Tuna, White Bean & Roast Pepper Pot — Foodie Fuel
name: Mediterranean Tuna, White Bean & Roast Pepper Pot — Foodie Fuel
method: Mix tuna, beans, roasted pepper and capers (1 min).
Dress with olive oil and lemon juice; season (1 min).
Fold through rocket just before serving (1 min).
plating: Pile into a bowl and finish with a crack of black pepper.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Chermoula Cod with Warm Lentil & Tomato Salad — Foodie Fuel
name: Chermoula Cod with Warm Lentil & Tomato Salad — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 210°C (fan 190°C). Rub cod with chermoula and oil.
Bake cod 12–15 minutes until it flakes easily.
Warm lentils, tomatoes and onion in a pan 6–8 minutes with a splash of water.
Stir in lemon juice and parsley; season.
Serve cod over the warm lentil salad.
plating: Lentils as the base, cod placed on top.
Finish with parsley and a squeeze of lemon.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Salsa Verde Chicken & Roast New Potatoes with Green Beans — Foodie Fuel
name: Salsa Verde Chicken & Roast New Potatoes with Green Beans — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 210°C (fan 190°C). Toss potatoes and chicken with oil and salt; roast 35–40 minutes until chicken is 75°C internal.
Boil green beans 3 minutes, drain.
Blend herbs, garlic, capers and lemon juice with 2 tbsp water to make salsa verde.
Serve chicken and potatoes with beans; spoon salsa verde over.
plating: Beans as a side stripe, chicken on potatoes, salsa verde dotted over.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Smoky Paprika Lentil ‘Bolognese’ with Wholewheat Spaghetti — Foodie Fuel
name: Smoky Paprika Lentil ‘Bolognese’ with Wholewheat Spaghetti — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 8 minutes.
Add garlic and carrot, cook 3 minutes. Stir in paprika and oregano 30 seconds.
Add tomatoes and lentils; simmer 15 minutes.
Cook spaghetti 10–12 minutes, drain and toss with the sauce.
plating: Twirl spaghetti, spoon extra sauce over, keep the rim clean.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Greek-Style Chicken & Giant Bean Stew (Fasolia) — Foodie Fuel
name: Greek-Style Chicken & Giant Bean Stew (Fasolia) — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook onion in oil 6 minutes. Add garlic and oregano 30 seconds.
Add chicken, cook 5 minutes until sealed.
Add tomatoes, beans and stock; simmer 20 minutes.
Stir in spinach 2 minutes to wilt; season.
plating: Ladle into bowls; finish with oregano and black pepper.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Korean-Style Beef & Broccoli with Brown Rice — Foodie Fuel
name: Korean-Style Beef & Broccoli with Brown Rice — Foodie Fuel
method: Blanch broccoli 2 minutes, drain.
Sear beef in a hot pan 3–4 minutes.
Stir in soy, sesame oil, honey, garlic and ginger with 2 tbsp water; bubble 1 minute.
Toss broccoli through to coat and heat 1 minute.
Serve over warm brown rice and sprinkle sesame seeds.
plating: Rice base, beef and broccoli piled high, sesame scattered.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Lemony Sardine & Lentil Pasta with Parsley Crumb — Foodie Fuel
name: Lemony Sardine & Lentil Pasta with Parsley Crumb — Foodie Fuel
method: Cook penne 10–12 minutes, reserve a splash of water and drain.
Toast breadcrumbs in a dry pan 2–3 minutes until golden; stir in parsley and a pinch of salt.
Warm sardines, lentils and garlic in a pan 2 minutes. Add pasta, lemon juice, zest and a splash of pasta water to loosen.
Top with parsley crumb.
plating: Twirl pasta into bowls, crumb sprinkled over the top.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Szechuan Chicken & Green Bean Stir-Fry with Brown Rice — Foodie Fuel
name: Szechuan Chicken & Green Bean Stir-Fry with Brown Rice — Foodie Fuel
method: Mix soy, vinegar, chilli crisp, cornflour, garlic and ginger with 3 tbsp water.
Stir-fry chicken 5–6 minutes until cooked through.
Add green beans and 2 tbsp water; cover and steam-fry 4 minutes.
Pour in sauce; toss 1–2 minutes until glossy.
Serve over warm brown rice.
plating: Rice base, stir-fry piled high, finish with extra chilli crisp if wanted.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Romesco Chickpea & Charred Cauliflower Bowls — Foodie Fuel
name: Romesco Chickpea & Charred Cauliflower Bowls — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Toss cauliflower and chickpeas with oil and smoked paprika.
Roast 25–30 minutes until charred.
Toss roasted mix with romesco and lemon juice.
Serve over salad leaves; scatter pumpkin seeds.
plating: Greens as the base, roasted mix on top, seeds scattered.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Jerk-Spiced Chicken & Pineapple Black Bean Rice — Foodie Fuel
name: Jerk-Spiced Chicken & Pineapple Black Bean Rice — Foodie Fuel

ingredients.item: Pineapple chunks (fresh or tinned in juice)

method: Cook chicken in oil 6–8 minutes until cooked through.
Add jerk seasoning and 2 tbsp water; coat chicken.
Stir in beans, rice and pineapple; heat 3–4 minutes.
Finish with lime juice and spring onion.
plating: Pack into a bowl mould if you want a neat dome; invert onto plate.
Scatter spring onion over the top.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Tandoori Roast Veg & Paneer with Minted Lentils — Foodie Fuel
name: Tandoori Roast Veg & Paneer with Minted Lentils — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Toss veg with oil and tandoori spice; roast 20 minutes.
Add paneer, roast 10–12 minutes more until golden.
Warm lentils in a pan 3 minutes with a splash of water. Stir in lemon juice and mint.
Serve roast veg and paneer over minted lentils.
plating: Lentils as a swoosh, paneer and veg stacked for height, mint scattered.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Coconut-Lime Mackerel & Sweet Potato Dhal — Foodie Fuel
name: Coconut-Lime Mackerel & Sweet Potato Dhal — Foodie Fuel
method: Rinse lentils. Simmer lentils and sweet potato with coconut milk and stock 20 minutes until thick.
Season mackerel with curry powder and a pinch of salt. Sear in a hot pan with oil 2–3 minutes per side until cooked through.
Finish dhal with lime juice and coriander.
Serve mackerel on top of the dhal.
plating: Dhal in a wide bowl, mackerel placed on top, coriander scattered.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Persian Chicken & Lentil Pilaf with Barberries (Optional) — Foodie Fuel
name: Persian Chicken & Lentil Pilaf with Barberries (Optional) — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 200°C (fan 180°C). Season chicken with cumin and cinnamon.
Sear chicken in oil 3 minutes each side, then set aside.
Soften onion in the same pan 6 minutes.
Stir in rice and lentils, add stock and barberries. Nestle chicken on top.
Cover tightly and bake 25 minutes. Rest 5 minutes, then fluff and finish with dill.
plating: Pile pilaf onto a plate, chicken set on top.
Finish with dill and a spoon of pan juices.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.

title: Lemongrass Tofu Vermicelli Bowls with Pickled Carrot — Foodie Fuel
name: Lemongrass Tofu Vermicelli Bowls with Pickled Carrot — Foodie Fuel
method: Toss tofu with soy sauce and lemongrass paste.
Sear tofu in oil 8–10 minutes until golden.
Soak vermicelli in boiling water 3–4 minutes; drain and rinse.
Quick-pickle carrot with vinegar, sugar and a pinch of salt for 10 minutes.
Build bowls: vermicelli, cucumber, pickled carrot, tofu, mint.
plating: Twirl vermicelli, arrange toppings in separate sections for a clean look.
Finish with mint and optional peanuts.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon works well here.

diabetesUK.notes: Aligned with Diabetes UK guidance: fibre present, balanced carbs, whole foods.
